summary: This is an email chain from August 25, 2020, between federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Southern District of Florida (SDFL). The SDNY team, prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell, is seeking to review and scan documents from the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators, which are stored in the West Palm Beach office. They are coordinating a call to arrange access to these materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the individual currently being prosecuted by the SDNY team in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the prior SDFL investigation, whose documents the SDNY team wishes to review.

connections.description: The document references Epstein's 'co-conspirators' and states Maxwell is being prosecuted in connection with the same case, implying their alleged criminal association.

events.title: Coordination for Document Review
events.description: Prosecutors from SDNY and SDFL exchange emails to schedule a call and arrange for the SDNY team to review and scan documents from the prior Epstein investigation stored in West Palm Beach.

locations: West Palm Beach Regional Office â€” SDFL
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell as of August 2020.
SDNY prosecutors sought access to documents from the prior Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators.
These SDFL Epstein-related documents and case files were stored in a secure room in the West Palm Beach office.
The materials included not only case files but also boxes of files gathered for an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) inquiry.
A prior OPR team had been on site, used a dedicated scanner, and sent documents directly to their DOJ accounts.
